Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else.....”
Reviews.Author: Char S
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? - FLITHY floors! My bare feet were BLACK after walking around on the laminate wood floors - Strong stale smokey smell - Twin bed mattresses are like cement slabs - Loud, boisterous 20 yr olds in hot tub. Had to yell out, "It's 11:30pm and some people are trying to sleep!" because no one was in the office to answer my call. - Bathrooms and kitchens had 1960-70's cabinetry and countertops. OLD - Garbage truck woke us up at a very early hour as it was right outside our window - Office person was supposed to call us back to let us know if we were able to upgrade from a studio unit to a 2 bedroom unit. We were surprised that we got the bigger one but because she didn't call us we had to pay for our children to stay several miles away at another place when they could have stayed with us

Reviews.Title: “Great and friendly staff at a good value resort”
Reviews.Author: jkennaway
Reviews.Content: We are owners of this time share and we loved Florida Vacation Villas. Great staff (Amy, Danielle and Jay were very helpful) clean and everything is nearby (shopping, restaurants Disney and golf. We really enjoy the family atmosphere and the Friday BBQ Our only disappointment was that there was only one week available when we booked Jeff & Diana Kennaway

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, especially the location, quality of the units and freindliness of the staff! ! !”
Reviews.Author: danphillips
Reviews.Content: Florida Vacation Villas has been constantly upgrading the units and property over the past 8 years or so, since we've been vacarioning there. The location is so convenient to all the attractions, baseball fields & golf courses we wouldn't want to stay any where else in the area. Thanks again to the wonderfull staff at FVV!

Reviews.Title: “Average place in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: N B
Reviews.Content: The location is good, the place was average. The place is in need of some updating and deep cleaning of carpets. The staff at check-in lied to us. We had requested a townhouse unit and had called them six months before arrival, then three months before arrival and then two weeks before arrival and every thime they said we could have it. The day of check in we called to say we were running late and they did not say anything to us that we could not have the townhouse unit. At check-in, they told us two units had plumbing problems and that they needed to be further evaluated and would be available to us on Monday and that we could move to either one of the units on Monday. Amy and Danielle in the front office did not know what the problem was and would not tell us what was wrong with the units. We planned our visits around Orlando around this information and on Monday when we called to move, they basically told us that they were not going to move us. The two units that had "plumbing" problems were both occupied by ohter families. By the way, we never saw any plumbers work on either unit. The staff did not care that we had contacted them six months, three months and two weeks prior to our arrival and how important the layout and location of the townhouse were to us. Every time we called they would say that they had "plenty" of townhouses available. What we think happened was that we booked our vacation through travel zoo for $28.00 a night, which is a steal for Orlando. We reserved through Wyndham Vacation Club on a special they had. When Florida Vacation Villas realized what we were paying, they refused to accomodate any request we had simply because they were making little money on us. If you are looking for a place to stay in Orlando and have to make a decision between Florida Vacation Villas and another location, I would choose the other location. We live in Tampa, FL and will certainly consider staying at this location again but if another location is equal, we will probably choose that location.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a good location and not mind that it's basically a motel with kitchen”
Reviews.Author: mv49
Reviews.Content: we didnt realize that there is a major difference what side of the street you get. we were across from the main part of the FVV's. we had a two bedroom condo which felt like a cheap motel with kitchen. there was food encrusted on some of the plates this never happened in our 25+ years of timeshare exchanges. everything was OK slightly dated and weird floorplan. noise carried easily. heard whenever the neighbors were showering because of loud fans and poor insulation same with dishwasher. couldnt get AC temperature below 76 even after we called. best thing about this place is LOCATION. 10 min to Disney etc so you dont have too much driving, near Publix and Walmart too. if you want a good location and will be out most of the time this could be a good place to stay. it was quiet in the evenings and felt safe. but we mostly just slept there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Location is great”
Reviews.Author: jeffhutcheson
Reviews.Content: We are owners of this time share, yet never seen it before. My wife and I are pretty tough people to please, yet if the hospitality is good, other things such as age of the condo and upgrades can be over looked. My brother and his wife went with us too, celebrating their 25th anniversity so we wanted a pleasant experience. The staff gave us a free up grade from originally discussed. One additional bedroom, queen and sleeper sofa and a kitchenette was given to us in addition to our regular supplied kitchen/dining --room. They didn't have to do this but gracious as they were, went beyond call,of duty. Does the place have some issues?, yes. It has some age on it, this can't be argued, however, every request we had was met in a timely fashion and satisfactory result. Its location is terrific. Close todisney, restraunts and shopping. Staff was extremely good to us, can't imagine anyone having a problem with them. Will we go back? In a heart beat, no hesitations here. Jeff from Arkansas

Reviews.Title: “It's really a fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pastored
Reviews.Content: I'm in a unit there as a write. It's not elegant, but it's much better than just a place to crash at night. Very clean, flooring and carpet seem brand new, furniture is fine, kitchen is well supplied and appliances are newer. Beds are not high-end hotel type beds, but I slept fine. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: Our family traveled from Lima, Ohio and had a wonderful time. We stayed in a two bedroom condo , Office staff threw a cookout one of the days we were there in May of 2011. I was very pleased with the great service as well as the pool area, will definitely be back . THANKS to the staff for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “We actually had fun there, but it's in MAJOR need of refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: lilheathen
Reviews.Content: We booked a unit in the Florida Vacation Villas last March through my brother-in-law's timeshare, for Thanksgiving week. I called a few weeks before we arrived to let them know we'd be coming in late Saturday night (thanks to reviews that told us their office is closed in the evenings so we could ask how do the late check-in). I got the info I needed from Amy, and I asked if we could be placed in a unit in the main section, not in the section across the street (thanks again to other reviewers about this info!). Amy confirmed we were indeed going to be in the main section. When we finally arrived after being stuck in heinous Orlando traffic, we were rather upset to learn we were in a villa across the street. There was nothing we could do about it at 10 pm, so we went to our villa. It was nicely appointed and spacious, with the master bedroom having one full wall of closets. The kitchen was small with little counter space, though. There was a flat-screen TV in the living room but older TVs in the bedrooms. The stove was an electric coil stove and the dishwasher was an old one that my parents had back in the 80s!! There was a nice gazebo with a patio table and four chairs in front of our unit, and the back patio faced a nice, grassy courtyard with a raised patio and another table and chair set. There was a small pool behind the units and a tennis court, along with laundry facility. We decided to make the best of it and decide the next day whether to see if we could be moved to the main section. By Sunday morning, we had uncovered NUMEROUS maintenance issues, and we spent the first half of the day with the maintenance man going in and out as he fixed one toilet, replaced the DVD player (broken remote), swapped batteries in the smoke detectors (one was beeping when we got in and the lights were out in all the others and likely dead), got the patio screen door back on the track, and tightened the wiggly toilet seat on the other toilet. The reception on the TV in the master bedroom was terrible. Once everything was fixed, we felt better about staying in there, but then the people above us came back from their day or checked in and literally were stomping around and letting their children run around. I finally called upstairs to let them know we could hear everything, and to my surprise, the women was very polite and agreed to keep it down. Dead silence for hours, and then they came back again at 11:30 pm. For an hour we endured major stomping around, the very loud and rapid squealing of the bed frame above our boys' bedroom (it kept them awake) and then the sound of a long shower (the roar of the water in the pipes was incredibly loud). That was enough for us. First thing Monday morning, we called and spoke to Danielle (Jay, the marketing guy who comes in on Sundays, does not have the authority to do room changes) and she immediately said she'd move us. So we spent Monday morning packing up and moving. At first glance, the new unit seemed fine, just seriously dated and in need of new counters, cabinets, and flooring (the carpet was torn in the bedroom, and several tiles were chipped, broken or scratched). But that night, we discovered that the master bath shower didn't work right: the temperature dial just spun and spun, so my husband got a lukewarm shower. Our king mattress was so old, that just sitting on the edge of the bed made the springs squeak. It was also sunken in on one side, so I slept in the middle. The headboard was not attached to anything and smacked the wall if we so much as turned over, so we had to pull the bed out. By the following day, it looked like it was going to collapse on us, so we used the nightstands to hold it in place. We called about the shower, but no one came on Tuesday, so we had to call again Wednesday morning (all five of us had to use one shower). When we got back to the room Tuesday night, we discovered water under the kitchen sink and in the dishwasher, which we hadn't run. Maintenance took care of both issues on Wednesday and then ran the dishwasher for us (very nice!). We were also pleasantly surprised to find a pumpkin pie on the counter, from the staff to help us celebrate Thanksgiving. The staff really does do their best; this place just needs an overhaul. In the main section of the villas (I hesitate to call this a resort, because that evokes an image of one of the amazing Marriott timeshare resorts we've been to), there is a larger pool, a hot tub, an outdoor pool table and a game room. We had wanted to be near all of that, and we were glad once we were so the kids could just walk out the patio door and go hang out without our needing to be there too the entire time. They were in the pool every night after we got back from the parks and had a great time (although they said the water in the hot tub looked yellow one night!! Gross.). The outdoor pool table and virtually all of the gaming tables in the game room are in need of replacement. The outdoor table has a tear in the fabric, but that didn't stop our enjoyment for a casual game. You have to ask for the cues and balls from maintenance if the office is closed. Luckily, Ken was walking by and brought them out for us. The pool table in the game room is so worn the metal is showing on the edges of the pockets. The air hockey table surface was smashed in on one side, as if someone nailed it with a pool cue. The foosball table had a broken attachment for one of the bars, and the tabletop shuffleboard surface was chipped. There was no water fountain, which would have been handy. My husband and boys went into the game room once and never went back. The on-site laundry consists of a couple of laundry rooms with coin-operated washers and dryers, but no change machines. It took two attempts to get our clothes dry the first time (you cannot choose the time; it's pre-set). No baskets were provided. We won't stay in another apartment-style resort without laundry in the unit again; it is FAR easier when it's in your unit and you don't have to forage for coins. It supposedly gets locked up at 10 pm but we were in there until 11 twice and it wasn't locked up (you use your room key to get in). I believe the reviewers who gave this property a 5-star review must have either been in refurbished units or just don't care about run-down units that have maintenance issues. We are pretty tolerant people and managed to enjoy ourselves anyway, and we appreciated the staff. We gave one star for them and one for the pool area, but we'd never stay here again. We have stayed in several timeshare resorts, with only the Marriott one being exemplary (RCI properties are too often run-down like this one), and we will stick with the Marriott. We don't mind older units, but we do mind run-down accommodations. Had we paid for this on a nightly basis, we would have checked out on Tuesday and stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Area Experience”
Reviews.Author: jfarlam
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Florida Vacation Villas, a timeshare with rentals less than 10 minutes from Disney. This is a privately managed resort, not part of a chain and does it ever make a difference. The friendliest and most helpful staff I have ever encountered made an otherwise good one week vacation delightful. The units are large and well appointed with complete kitchen and all the dishes and pans to cook for four kids which can really hold down the cost of a vacation. Some of the furniture and flooring seemed brand new so it seemed that an ongoing upgrade was in place. We went to Disney once(10 mins) and Sea World once(20 mins) and it was great to come "home" to our own beds and food and stuff for a great night's sleep. From our unit it was only about a hundred feet to a large newly refinished pool with a huge deck and plenty of chairs that were never full. WiFi was free if a little slow at times. On Friday they threw a free barbeque around the pool and all the guests agreed this was a place to come to again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mat P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Florida Vacation 8-15 October 2011. Our villa was a two bedroom, 2 bath unit. We were impressed by the amount of room we had. Compared to our room at the Country Inn down the road that we stayed in two years prior, this was a palace! It was clean and comfortable and the staff was really nice. The only problem we had was with the dishwasher and it was fixed within the hour we reported it. The swimming pool was right outside of the back door. It was clean and had hardly anyone in it. The Villa’s are only a few miles from the Disney main gate, which was super convenient. We had no bug problems. Maybe the people that did don’t take their trash out. We enjoyed our time and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Emmaculate accomodations...superb staff...best vacation stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nhan V
Reviews.Content: We knew we made the right choice upon our phone reservation with Florida Vacation Villas. Our flight was delayed and arrived very late in the evening. As a result, the staff was extremely accomodating by making arrangements so that we could still acquire our rooms and complete our check-in the next morning. All staff members were genuine and willing to help in every way. They truly enjoyed working with everyone they encountered - a class act organization! The accomodations were immaculate and spacious. Our party of seven (four adults and three young children) had ample room and appreciated the privacy. The children enjoyed the game room, pool, tennis and basketball courts. The adults appreciated the location which allowed access for shopping, restaurants, and Disney attractions all within a few short miles. Great location, superb rates, emmaculate accomodations, exceptional staff...we won't go anywhere else when coming back to the Orlando area. Thank you Florida Vacation Villas for making our Disney vacation a memorable one!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place and best service we could ask for”
Reviews.Author: basscreator
Reviews.Content: Our 4th time to disney area. Have rented timeshares in past, but this one far exceeded all. The check-in was great! Because we were staying 2 consecutive weeks, they put us in a condo so we wouldn't have to move the 2nd week. Everything I liked: They have towel exchange every tues and thurs's. Large beautiful swimming pool, with hardly anyone ever in it. They provide all detergent's, even free laundry det. Free barbecque lunch on fri provided to all guests. Best location!!! One block off highway 192. Publix and super target one block away. Super wal mart 2 blocks at highway 535. Close to all parks. Restaurants all around the corner. The condo's are all super clean. The staff are extra helpful and very nice! There's a wonderful gamesroom, fitness room, and 2 tennis courts. There is rarely anyone at any of these. After the 1st week, they had a maid come in to change linen and clean condo. I felt like a queen! With 3 kids, I only had to wash clothes. Not towels and linen. Will definitely be returning again!!!! There's no ritz and glamour, but the upkeep and tasteful decor along with all the other positive things clearly make up for that!

Reviews.Title: “Private no hassle accommodations with receptive & responsive staff”
Reviews.Author: meebse972
Reviews.Content: Our 3-bedroom units(we had 2 families) were located in the overflow resort area about a mile & half from main location. Sweetwater Circle was a nice private location backed up to a lake teeming with wild life(otter, ducks, herons and of course fish). The 2 upper units were moderately upgraded, in need of a few maintenance items and the staff responded quickly and professionally to any issues that came up. Located about 15-20 min from the Disney parks with Super Target just down the street. Pool area was nice enough with wifi at the club house. Kids play area and volleyball courts need some upkeep but were functional. Not a glitzy location but served it's purpose fine.

Reviews.Title: “1ST CLASS CONTACT & HELP FROM STAFF & 1ST CLASS BASE FOR ATTRACTIONS!”
Reviews.Author: handlamp
Reviews.Content: We found that the staff at the Florida Vacation Villas wanted to make sure that your stay with them was inviting, comfortable and that all facilities/attractions etc were explained in a very helpful way. We found this Resort to be very homely and would highly recommend it for comfort & location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff......count us in for next year!”
Reviews.Author: toomanykids8
Reviews.Content: I have to say, not sure where the person below me tried calling. Every time I called I was greeted by the nicest person. They were so helpful, and they even sent me an email with directions and all the info I needed for a late check-in. Loved the resort, so clean and friendly. My kids enjoyed the pool, they even called it their own private pool. Phase I was a great location for the kids and it was nice to have a bathroom right by he pool. The munchies in the morning were nice to throw in the purse for a snack. Just a mention to everyone that Guest Services is not with Florida Vacation Villas (a different company), it is not just a breakfast for "owners" it is a SALES TOUR!!! Jason the Guest Services makes it sound like it is a must and all you are doing is a viewing a model. That is not true, but if you like SALES TOURS then you should sign up. Thank you to the staff for making our vacation special. Came back one day from Sea World and my kids had fun stuff in the unit from the Front Desk. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “5 visits and we keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: NCDawnM
Reviews.Content: We get RCI weeks and have a choice of several RCI units. We have stayed in a few different ones through our years of going to Orlando for vacation. Check-in: Staff is very friendly and helpful and does go the extra mile to keep guests happy. There is also a number to call during off-hours if you need help. We found this out AFTER we needed them and didn't see the sign, but for future visits we now know to call. We have only had a problem once in our 5 stays but Monday morning they let us change units. Pluses: 1. The units now have wi-fit which we are very happy about! In the past, we had to go over to the game room to get internet, but now we can get it in our unit which is a huge plus for us. 2. There is a game room with a pool table in it. We used it some. We have used the pool and the hot tub in the past, although for our December trip we did not. 3. The front office does have coffee and sweet rolls every morning if one is interested. Units: There are several different types of units at this location. We prefer the units directly across from the main office as they are two story and so you don’t need to worry about bothering folks below you or having to hear folks above you. I am told these are harder to get during peak season, but we normally travel off season when they don’t have the units fully occupied. We have stayed in one of the 3 bedroom units in the main building, but we didn’t like these nearly as much. The layout is awkward and the kitchen seemed much smaller. However, it is nice to have these available for families who might need them. Minuses: No really big complaints. We get these units for a great deal and know we are getting older units, so the need for updating isn’t an issue for us. They are clean and functional and large enough to spread out, which is exactly what we need after a long day in the parks. If you are looking for a new unit with full upgrades, this would not be the place to stay, but for the cost and value, we find it great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: lillissa
Reviews.Content: Loved Florida Vacation Villas. Great staff, very clean, recently renovated. Only complaint was that pool wasn`t heated. Close to restaurants, walmart, grocery stores.

Reviews.Title: “January 2007 was our 4th and last visit So Far”
Reviews.Author: lananick
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this place. The villas are fantastic and the staff are even better. 3 Visits to Kissimmee vacation villas and would recommend it to everyone. The only place we go that we don't want to come home from. Old town is a must 2 visit

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: Cambridge1010
Reviews.Content: Florida Vacation Villas is awesome! We felt like we were in a home away from home. Had 2-Story condo, w/2 Bedrooms and 3 baths. Beds were great and I usually don't sleep well away form home so that was huge. Very clean, had everything we needed. Great to relax in the hottub at the end of our busy days. Great location, so close to everything. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Peaceful place - great place close to Disney, Epcot, dining and shopping”
Reviews.Author: friendlilady
Reviews.Content: The unit I has was a 2 bedroom with jacuzzi. It had everything we needed. The staff was friendly and helpful. Back entrance to Disney was just 5 minutes away. Close to Medieval Times. close to all the shops on 192 ... and there's a outlet shop that has a Nike store with great prices. In Kissimmee - the golf is affordable too. The public courses are beautiful. Will definitely go there again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, great location, peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: vickie62
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location on two occasions, approximately 3 years apart. My parents go every year without fail. If you want entertaining by reps, this is not the place for you. If you want numerous bars, restaurants (and the associated noise) to choose from at a stones throw (think International drive), this is not the place for you. If you want amazingly friendly staff, a quiet pool, (ok, so it can be a bit chilly..but swim and you get warm!) decent accomodation (which has always been clean when we and my parents have stayed!!) then this could be the place for you. It is not a 24 hour reception, it is open on Sundays however. We have never had any issues staying at this location, and we all love it. Planning to return in 2014!!

Reviews.Title: “worse experience ever. beware!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: srafford
Reviews.Content: We showed up at 7 pm to check in only to find out that they front office was closed. Called the number that was on the front door to see what was going on, and needless to say they (the answering service) said that they didn't have any record of our confirmation number, even though I have the print out from them in my hand. Waited for 2 hours for the manager to call me back...never called..then waited for the maintiance to call, and they never did as well. Very unproffesional. All this with 2 tired kids!! They never called us back to apologize or anything. Luckily the website that we booked with gave us a much better place to stay, that was open 24 hrs a day. Who ever heard of a place that closes at 7???? Not a good way to start my vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MNDad63
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom booked through RCI. While the resort is older it still is very comfortable, clean, conveniently located and the staff could not be nicer. Our room was a 2 level 2 bedroom with 3 baths and full kitchen and walked right out to the pool area. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice, comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable resort, will go there again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: livinlarge09
Reviews.Content: We were skeptical about going to this resort, but were pleasantly surprised with.It exceeded our expectations. We stayed in ' Royal Palms' with our 2 teen age kids. We exchanged our RCI 2 BR and got a 3 BR in these villas. As we entered Royal palms there is not security or gate. We noticed that. The units look run down from outside and the entrance is strange as we were on the ground floor. Once we turned the key in, we were pleasantly surprised. Big plasma tv in the living room Very nicely maintained unit and tastefully decorated. It was in vintage style and we instantly felt at home. We did not get to use or even visit any of the resort facilities but the whole stay was very comfortable. We recommend this place and will consider it in our future travels. Thanks to the staff for making our stay very nice and relaxing. We had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay here”
Reviews.Author: jpm19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Florida Vacation Villas over Easter. The location was perfect for us - we had our own car and were busy the entire time - Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure, Gatorland, Medieval Times, Animal Kingdom, Magic Kingdom, Hollywood Studios, and Cocoa Beach. The unit was clean and functional. We were located on the first floor across from the pool, playground and barbecue - perfect! Staff were more than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid! Poor Amenities and Staff”
Reviews.Author: SKayM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Florida Vacation Villas over Thanksgiving week in a 2 bedroom, 2 1/2 bath townhouse. The unit fine for the most part - some updating had been done... However, when I called to confirm my reservations the week before I was assured that we would be able to swim in a HEATED pool. Monday evening my family and I tried to swim, but the water temperature simply wasn't warm enough for an evening swim. I called the following day to ask if the temperature could be adjusted. The front desk clerk informed me that it would take a few days to heat and asked if I was staying for one or two weeks. I told her one and she said that it probably wouldn't be heated enough to swim in before I left. I found the staff glossing over problems like this constantly. I was told that Guest Services would be open on Sunday. It wasn't. The facility is not manned 24/7, so if you have any problems or questions you have to wait until normal business hours. Checking in and out early or late is not especially convenient. They advertise WIFI, but it is only in the Guest Services area. The staff did inform me that if I wanted to use the Internet in the evening that I could sit on a bench outside of the office and my laptop could probably pick up the signal. Great. You also have to take out your own trash, which is located at the very back of the property behind some buildings - we had to put the trash in the car and drive it. The tour that they offer should be avoided at all costs!! It is a scam with pushy, rude salespersons. We were there for over 3 hours!! I filed a written complaint that was over 2 pages long. For a completely enjoyable Florida experience I would NOT recommend Florida Vacation Villas. It is worth the extra money to stay at a location that is staffed with true professionals who understand customer service and working amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Karyn1990
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Florida Vacation Villas and we were very happy with the accommodations. We stayed in a two bedroom, two bath unit in the building across the street from the main complex. The decor is a little dated, but everything was in good working condition and clean - no bugs or smoke smells. The kitchen had a good supply of pots, pans, dishes, utensils and appliances. The bathrooms were fine. My only complaint was that the soap dispenser in the master shower is mounted in an awkward spot and I kept bumping my shoulder on it and since we stayed during Thanksgiving week, we only got to exchange towels once during the week and I ended up buying some extras on Thanksgiving day. There is a small pool and playground located behind the building we were in, but the better pool with the hot tub is across the street along with the pool table and game room. We enjoyed the free Krispy Kreme donuts and coffee in the office each morning. We were only asked once if we wanted to do the "tour" of another property and when we declined we weren't pressured or pestered again. The staff gave us a pumpkin pie which we enjoyed after our Thanksgiving dinner. Surprisingly, I had no problem preparing a small "feast" for the family using the supplies provided in the kitchen and the dining table was large enough to accomodate all 5 of us and our feast with room to spare! This was definitely not a 5 star resort/spa experience, but it was a homey and comfortable place to relax and unwind in between vacation activites.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some say, but could be better......”
Reviews.Author: Herfnerd
Reviews.Content: Decided to take a last minute trip to Orlando with the kids before school started and no RCI Gold or Silver Crown resorts were available so we booked FVV for the week. The place is conveniently located just off Irlo Bronson Hwy and while its somewhat quiet and secluded, it is right around the corner from restaurants and within two miles of a Super Target and two Wal Marts. The complex is small and dated. Office closes at 5pm. Game room is pretty sparce. Pool area with a jacuzzi and grill is very well kept. We stayed in a 2 BR/2 BA unit on the second floor. The outside of the unit definitely needed a good powerwashing. Inside had all the amenities one would need with the exception of a washer/dryer. Garbage disposal would be nice, too. We did have some crawly critters welcome us, but a couple of shots of Home Defense Max kept them out for the week. Beds were a little old and worn, but serviceable. TV's in both BR's worked fine. Sofa bed in living room didn't completely fold in, but that was OK. A/C kept the place cool. Linen exchange twice a week and they were prompt. Other than that, we didn't need the services of the front desk or maintenance. We spent every day at Wet N Wild, Sea World, Universal Studios, etc so the above issues were not a problem for us, but had we stayed in more, I think they might have been. Overall, it was a decent stay but definitely only because we weren't able to book at a Gold/Silver Crown Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: rugratmama
Reviews.Content: My four kids and I decided to go visit my new baby nephew in Orlando, so we booked a week at florida vacation villas. The unit was in dated condition; however, it was clean and very spacious. Also, the refrigerator was leaky, some of the tv remotes didn't work, but even with those minor issues we still had a pleasant stay. There was a small pool that was empty most of the time. I guess everyone was doing the disney thing and we weren't. My daughter said the gym was dated and most of the equipment was in some state disrepair, but we are the type of family that makes the most of our vacation no matter what and we had a blast. If you're looking for state of the art accomodations, then this place isn't for you. but if you just want a clean quiet place to lay your head after a day at the parks, then vacation villas is a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ensuite Bathroom needs a lot of work!!”
Reviews.Author: retiredtravellers05
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, we were initially apprehensive, since it was definitely not up to the type of accommodations, we generally stay at. Upon entering, it appeared OK. Living Room, Kitchen and Dining areas seemed bright and cheery . The one bathroom had been re-done and again was fine. However, upon checking the bedrooms, all the Bedspreads should have been discarded years ago. We promptly took them off and left them off for the duration of our stay. Heaven only knows, when they were last laundered. The bedrooms has old, out-dated, dirty carpets. The other rooms were fine, since they were vinyl, so they looked OK. The mattress in the main bedroom, creeked and groaned with the slightest movement...good job we were exhausted after the day spent at the Disney Parks. The ensuite bath was a disgrace! The tub faucets were missing parts. The tub could not hold water, and the tub faucets was not working. The shower door was something else!!! Just plain disgusting!! Beside being disgusting looking, it hardly moved, so it was very difficult to get in and out. Another odd thing - they do a "towel exchange" on Tuesdays and Thursdays, which seems strange, since you only have 1 day between Tuesday & Thursday, but 4 days between Thursday and Tuesday. Another thing, the Laundry facilities were old and dilapitated. We were just glad that we carry cleaning supplies and disenfectants ... we certainly needed it. And, thank heavens, we were only there to shower and sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: langer25
Reviews.Content: I have to say that after reading some of these comments before I arrived made me nervous! But after staying here and being treated better then any resort I have every been to, was great. The people there are wonderful and the place was nothing like how some of these people described it. I fould my unit clean and well supplied. I was in unit 107 and I loved the area and location. We were right by the pool and the pool bathrooms were right there if we needed them. The resort had a BBQ on Friday for all the guest and we went to the another pool they had and that was a nice addition to the week. Thanks to the staff and mangement company. We had a great time and we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: mayilum
Reviews.Content: My family and I (6 adults & 2 kids) checked into Florida Vacation Villas on 9/29/07. We had to pick up our keys from a safe box since our arrival was after 7 PM. It was approximately 9 PM when we walked to where our room was at. Before entering our villa, we noticed a couple of dirty laundry bags were placed in front of our door. The maid apparently did not take it away. Anyhow, we then entered our villa and instantly, we can smell the gross strong odor of cigarettes. The cigarettes smell was SO intense that my family could not take it. We opened all the windows and blast the air conditioner. We then walked around the room and were not pleased with what we saw. If we could, we would have gone to another hotel but it was too late since we would have lost the $350 deposits. Anyhow, we promptly went to WalMart to get ourselves some cleaning supply and sanitizers. Once we got back, we did some major spraying and cleaning before we felt comfortable with the place :-) The Villa is old and need some major face lifts. We all were disappointed with the Villa since we expected something more decent and clean. Oh, you can see some tiny insects crawling around the kitchen and bathrooms :-) Bottomline is, "Florida Vacation Villa" is NOT a great place to stay at but we didn't let the place ruined our vacation. In fact, the run down villa forced us to do more outside activities. We basically only came back to the Villa to shower and sleep :-) My family and I had fun spending quality time together in Florida for the wk. Would I ever come back to Florida Vacation Villa? => HELL NO!!! Would I ever recommend Florida Vacation Villa to anyone? => Yeah, if I hate you. Otherwise, HELL NO!!!! BTW, the staff may be nice BUT they will NEVER ask you, "How you like your room" or "How you like your stay". Reason being, they know the responses will be negative if customers were to really speak the truth :-) Anyhow, if you do decide to stay at Florida Vacation Villa, then stay there at your own risk and enjoy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay..... Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: travelerwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for one week, June 30, 2007-July 7, 2007. Upon arrival and the condition of the outside buildings it did not look too bad. Once inside the villa, we were very disappointed. The sofas and furniture were a bit dated, but in good condition. The worst was the cleanliness, it was absolutely disgusting. I drove down the street to Wal-Mart and bought cleaning supplies before I would even begin to use the bathrooms. The shower doors were broke and very hard to push back and forth, and it looked as if they had never been cleaned. There was alot of mold and mildew, which I scrubbed with Clorox and a toothbrush. Had this been cleaned properly each and every time a guest departs the villa, it would not have looked this way. Overall, we were very unahppy with how dirty the villa was, otherwise the villa was okay. If you plan on spending a day at the villa to relax and enjoy the pool, think again. This is not a family friendly resort with activities planned each day, nor is the pool very accomodating for younger children. There is not a restaurant nor a bar on the properry, so you're not able to catch a night cap or food. There are alot of restuarants down the road, however not quite as convenient as on the property. I will never stay at this property again, and I absolutely discourage anyone from staying here. It is worth the extra money in my opinion, to stay in a clean family friendly environment. If you've already booked here and can not change your plans, just expect to have to clean the villa upon arrival!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the place until Mother In Law contracted Legionnaires disease there”
Reviews.Author: jeffpags
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 14-20th, with three adults and three children. The unit we stayed in was unit 1109, one of the first units on the left. The unit was roomy with two levels and suited our needs with two bedrooms and two baths on the second floor, and another bath on the first floor along with a full kitchen, dining and living room. Unit opened up into a small pool area in the rear that was fenced in. The pool and hottub were small and dated but served their purpose. The villas were close to Disney and local grocery stores and restuarants which was great, about 15 mins to Disney. The only bad thing to say about the Villas was that my mother-in-law became very ill after returning from our stay and it was determined to be legionnaires disease which was likely caused by poor ventilation in the unit, and to this date management or RCI has failed to reply to our notification of such, which was very disappointing to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “love it here, will be back again and again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kolyahnatiw
Reviews.Content: 3 rd year owners, very neat clean and corteus. we come back every year as its close to everything, dont have to worry about a thing. if something is not functioning properly they fix it immediately. we will continue going year in and out as our kids r still young. considering when you go most the days u r at the water parks and disney. you always have a clean rerfreshing place to come back and either eat in or order in or just use the always clean pool and spa. i have never been bothered to see other timeshares by them like some companies do. the place is wonderful and quiet. may not be full of restaurants and shops but 1/4 mile up the road is international drive and that has it all!!!!!!!!!! cant wait to return!!!!!!!!!! a paradise away from home

HotelInfo.Name: Florida Vacation Villas
HotelInfo.Address: 2777 North Poinciana Blvd, Kissimmee, FL 34746
